FORM 6-K                   
                                              
      SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION      
                                              
            Washington, D.C. 20549            
                                              
      Report of a Foreign Private Issuer      
                                              
      Pursuant to Rule 13a-16 or 15d-16       
    of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934    
For the month of October, 2024                
Commission File Number: 001-13928             
             Royal Bank of Canada             
                                              
             (Name of registrant)             
                                              
  200 Bay Street        1 Place Ville Marie   
  Royal Bank Plaza      Montreal, Quebec      
  Toronto, Ontario      Canada H3B 3A9        
  Canada M5J 2J5        Attention: Senior     
  Attention: Senior     Vice-President,       
  Vice-President,       Deputy General        
  Deputy General        Counsel               
  Counsel               & Secretary           
  & Secretary                                 
                                              
   (Address of principal executive offices)   
Indicate by check mark whether the registrant
files or will file annual reports under cover
of Form 20-F or Form 40-F.
                              
  Form 20-F o    Form 40-F x  
                              
Indicate by check mark if the registrant is
submitting the Form 6-K in paper as permitted
by Regulation S-T Rule 101(b)(1): o

Indicate by check mark if the registrant is
submitting the Form 6-K in paper as permitted
by Regulation S-T Rule 101(b)(7): o

THIS REPORT ON FORM 6-K AND THE EXHIBITS
HERETO SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE INCORPORATED
BY REFERENCE AS EXHIBITS TO ROYAL BANK OF
CANADA’S REGISTRATION STATEMENT ON FORM F-3
(FILE NO. 333-275898) AND TO BE
A PART THEREOF FROM THE DATE ON WHICH THIS
REPORT IS FURNISHED, TO THE EXTENT NOT
SUPERSEDED BY DOCUMENTS OR REPORTS
SUBSEQUENTLY FILED
OR FURNISHED.
Exhibits are filed herewith in connection with
the issuance of the
following Senior Global Medium-Term Notes,
Series J (the “Notes”) by Royal Bank of Canada
(the “Bank”) on the
date of this report on Form 6-K, pursuant to
the Bank’s shelf registration statement on
Form F-3 (File No. 333-275898):
                                              
     $650,000,000 aggregate principal amount  
  ·  of Senior Floating Rate Notes, Due       
     October 18, 2027                         
                                              
                                              
     $750,000,000 aggregate principal amount  
  ·  of 4.510% Senior Fixed Rate/Floating     
     Rate Notes, Due October 18, 2027         
                                              
                                              
     $450,000,000 aggregate principal amount  
  ·  of Senior Floating Rate Notes, Due       
     October 18, 2028                         
                                              
                                              
     $850,000,000 aggregate principal amount  
  ·  of 4.522% Senior Fixed Rate/Floating     
     Rate Notes, Due October 18, 2028         
                                              
                                              
     $2,000,000,000 aggregate principal       
  ·  amount of 4.650% Senior Fixed            
     Rate/Floating Rate Notes, Due October    
     18, 2030.                                
                                              
                   EXHIBITS                   
                                              
  Exhibit    Description                      
             of Exhibit                       
             Opinion of Sullivan              
             & Cromwell LLP, U.S. counsel     
  5.1        for the Bank, as to the          
             validity of the Notes under New  
             York law.                        
             Opinion of Norton Rose           
             Fulbright Canada LLP, Canadian   
  5.2        counsel for the Bank, as to      
             certain matters under Canadian,  
             Ontario and Québec law.          
             Opinion of Sullivan & Cromwell   
  8.1        LLP, U.S. counsel for the Bank,  
             as to certain matters of United  
             States federal income taxation.  
             Opinion of Norton Rose           
             Fulbright Canada LLP, Canadian   
  8.2        counsel for the Bank, as to      
             certain matters of Canadian      
             federal income taxation.         
             Consent of Sullivan              
  23.1       & Cromwell LLP (included in      
             Exhibits 5.1 and 8.1 above).     
             Consent of Norton                
  23.2       Rose Fulbright Canada LLP        
             (included in Exhibits 5.2 and    
             8.2 above).                      
                                              
                  Signatures                  
Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly
caused this report to be signed on its behalf
by the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized.
                                              
          ROYAL BANK OF
